item.title: New York City is moving to ban phones from school. Will it work?
item.description: New York may soon be the largest district in the U.S. to ban phones from the classroom. “They’re not just a distraction, kids are fully addicted now to phones," says the city's schools chancellor.

item.title: Abortion bans still leave a 'gray area' for doctors after Idaho Supreme Court case
item.description: The decision on abortion that the Supreme Court handed down Thursday was narrow. But confusion for doctors in abortion ban states about how to deal with pregnancy emergencies remains widespread.

item.title: Boeing's new spacecraft is forced to extend its stay at the International Space Station
item.description: The spacecraft experienced numerous leaks and technical glitches. NASA says it's using the extra time to evaluate whether it can return safely.

item.title: Biden and Trump point out during debate why the other's presidency failed
item.description: President Biden and former President Trump took questions from CNN moderators for 90 minutes. Biden started out hard to follow. Trump confidently made assertions that were often factually wrong.

item.title: In Lebanon, the 'Amber Man' digs up golden time capsules from the age of the dinosaurs
item.description: When dinosaurs reigned some 130 million years ago, flowering plants were taking over the world. That change is sealed in ancient amber specimens on the slopes of Lebanon that Danny Azar knows so well.
